bug.author: jmugan
bug.description:
When I run the noun chunker over the phrase "100 tacos with a side of rice" it returns "a side" and "rice" but not "100 tacos". The word "tacos" has the dependency label (dep_) of "ROOT". I think the problem may be that english_noun_chunks in spacy.syntax.iterators has 'root' as lowercase. See line 5 <denchmark-code>labels = ['nsubj', 'dobj', 'nsubjpass', 'pcomp', 'pobj', 'attr', 'root'] </denchmark-code>
When I add 'ROOT' to labels it works as expected and returns "100 tacos". Of course, there may be a reason that 'root' is different from 'ROOT' that I am not aware of.

comments.comment: Definitely a bug — thanks for the report. If you have time, would you mind submitting a pull request with a test and the patch?

I put in the change and the test, but when I try to build locally with I get the error listed at <denchmark-link:http://9.media.readthedocs.io/projects/spacy/builds/3893054/>http://9.media.readthedocs.io/projects/spacy/builds/3893054/</denchmark-link>
Broken build is sadness — I want to make sure this doesn't happen in future. Anyway. The problem is fixed for 1.0. Thanks again for the report.
